The price while a bit higher than other bids, was justified by the assignment of a project manager who helped with the design, met me at the home improvement store to pick out the specific tiles and provided exact measurements,  and who provided me with on going supervision of the workers and timely status updates.  

The workers showed up on time and took great care to protect the carpet and the rest of the house.    The work quality was excellent.  I would highly recommend them for the quality of their work.

Rich
Irvine, CA

The project: a kitchen renovation that involved demolishing the old kitchen, building a completely new kitchen in a different location (the old dining area), opening a wall, and building an addition onto the house to add a wet bar

Overall, we had a great experience with Horizon.  They delivered what they said they would, when they said they would, for the price they said it would be.  The work crews were friendly and professional; we were very impressed by their efficiency and the long hours they often worked to complete the project quickly.  As this was our first major renovation, we did sometimes feel some stress about communication (namely knowing when fixtures and decisions were needed from us), but things generally went smoothly.  We are very pleased with the final product and would certainly work with Horizon again.

My wife and I had Horizon remodel two bathrooms at the same time due to a sub floor problem.  The job was performed in a professional ,manner and actually was complete a week early.   The project manager was very professional and assisted us at every step.  Bottom line, I would use this contractor again when the next project arises.  Months after, we required some minor followup repairs and contacted Horizon.  Michael Reppo, the project manager, responded almost immediately.  He came out and inspected and set up the days the crews were to come out and repair.  Really appreciated the prompt and helpful "AFTER SERVICE" care given to my wife and I.

This is our 2nd project with Horizon.  First was an awesome kitchen/family room remodel.  This time they did a bathroom remodel, and porcelain tile flooring (living, dining, entry, hall, bath, laundry).  Mark (owner) provided a detailed estimate of cost as well as telling us what our responsibilities were.  There were NO surprise costs.  Mark hires skilled workers (painter, electrician, tile guy, plumber...) who are always on time and polite (no loud talk or radios), able to communicate with me (I speak only English), do meticulous work, and clean up daily before they leave.  Mark is on site almost every day to oversee the quality of work.  Mark and Enna (his wife) are great to work with and responsive to all my texts and emails.  We are going to use Horizon for our next big project (inside staircase redo and new front door).  It's great to have a company you can trust!
Enna and staff are all very helpful. We had a complete demo and remodel of our Master Bath.  It all came out beautifully and could not be happier.

We knew from our experience that this would be a big project, and it would require patience.We needed to remove a weight bearing wall, and reinforce the foundation in three places. This included installing two massive beams in the ceiling to support the roof! This was a Kitchen REBUILD! This old house had the original 1955 yellow tile and linoleum kitchen. We told Mike, our Project Manager that our Prime Concern was the end result. But we wanted him to be as accurate as possible in estimating the start date, and the length of project--and to be HONEST about the predicted time frame. He said they could start in 2-4 weeks as they were so busy--(a good sign). he predicted it would take 3 months to complete, not including holidays. They began within 2 and 1/2 weeks, And they completed our BEAUTIFUL NEW KITCHEN in exactly 3 calendar months which included holidays and weekends!!! We are very happy with the end result, quality materials, and workmanship!!!

Horizon did a great job with our master bathroom remodel!  We wanted to update the original master bathroom in our home (approximately 20 years old) and they had great ideas to help us realize our goal of a creating a open and modern space.  Their team was very professional, focused on the details, and executed the plan we developed together.  Everyone including the workers, project manager, and owners did a great job.  Thank you Horizon!

We hired Horizon Construction to demolish our 1950’s kitchen and construct a brand new one. From the beginning they were up front and professional.  We were overwhelmed with all the many choices with design and color.  Since Horizon Construction has a showroom, Mark and Enna were able to help us create the vision we had for our kitchen.  Once the project was underway, we were updated daily by Enna as to when the workers would be here.  We were grateful for their reliability since we were living in our home during the construction. That made this large project much less stressful.  The workers were trustworthy, courteous and respectful of our property.  Throughout the entire project there were only a few issues, as there would be with any project of this magnitude; Mark and his project manager Tal addressed them immediately.  Horizon Construction was a little more expensive than our other bids but you do get what you pay for.  Our kitchen turned out fantastic!  We love it!!

They came out to bid the job, but when they gave me a price they said that if I did not sign up with them THAT NIGHT then the price would go up by close to 10%, even if it was the following morning.  I explained that I did not do business that way.  Weeks later I asked if they would honor their original price and they quoted me a price that was 15% higher than the original price.

After years of dreaming about remodeling our kitchen, collecting photos from DIY websites and magazines, I was finally able to convince my husband that our 1967 house needed some updating to accommodate our huge family and our hope of “aging in place”. A simple kitchen project became a more extensive downstairs remodel with a new full bathroom and universal shower. We spent months making detailed drawings and lists incorporating what we wanted it to look like. Being life-long DIYers, we entertained the idea of being an owner/contractor but soon realized that the project would involve many structural changes (moving sewer lines, load bearing walls, etc) as well as extensive knowledge of our city’s building codes. In other words, it was beyond our capabilities. We narrowed our search for a contractor to four based on recommendations from neighbors and reviews on the internet, then received estimates and descriptions of the work to be done. Admittedly, we were shocked when all the estimates were almost double what we were anticipating the work to cost… ahh, the price of naivete! While not the least expensive, Mike Roppo, representing Horizon Construction and Remodeling, was the most thorough, knowledgeable and professional of them all.  
Demo started mid-September, final inspection was in mid-February, almost 6 weeks longer than first estimated. We had some glitches and delays along the way:  additional engineering specs, an additional support post, adding a new sheer wall, etc. More time, more money. We were wisely advised to plan on having a 15-20% cushion for unforeseen expenses. Stuff happens!
Electrical, plumbing, framing, drywall, flooring, tile, cabinets, painting, finish carpentry… the crews were great! They all worked hard, cleaned the job site daily, were respectful, communicative-we couldn’t have asked for more from them. Mike was our go-to project manager every step of the way. His code of quality even exceeded ours! We are so grateful to have had him work with us. Mark Besnos  (owner of Horizon Construction) checked in frequently to make sure the work being done met his high standards as well. Mark’s wife Enna and the office staff (Anna and Carolyn) kept us informed as to the work schedule and who to expect on the job site. They were easy to communicate with and always available to address our questions and concerns.
Bottom line, we love our remodeled home and would recommend Horizon Remodeling and Construction…yes, even to our family members.

Recently, we were looking to completely remodel our 1968 master bathroom and create a comfortable, beautiful and functional retreat.  After reading many reviews and viewing several sites, we contacted Horizon Construction and Remodeling to take on the project.  From the first meeting until the final sign off, we found the team to be completely professional, knowledgeable and trustworthy.  During our initial consultation, Mark took our vision and made a beautiful and workable plan that incorporated the custom cabinets and high-end finishes which were consistent with our preferences.  Those plans were transformed into a stunning and comfortable oasis which we enjoy on a daily basis.  When we had questions, changes, or concerns, they were addressed immediately and always to our satisfaction.  During several inspections, our city inspector commented on the outstanding job the team was doing and the rapid pace at which they were completing projects.  The office would keep us informed regarding the daily schedule and as to which teams would be here.  The workman are all skilled craftsmen which shows in their work.  They were respectful, courteous, and meticulous.  Everyday the workspace and surrounding areas were cleaned methodically, taking great care to protect our hardwood floors. This process was first rate from beginning to end, so much so we will be using them in the future to remodel our kitchen.  Quality work, craftsmanship at the highest level, and a professional team, Horizon Construction and Remodeling are top notch and I would recommend them to everyone whether your project is small or large.  Horizon can do it all.  Thank you Horizon for a job well done!

I called for appointment after reading reviews:
Met with Horizon on January 12, 2016, at least an hour, will be giving me an estimate
Jan. 23, I called office Mgr. Anna to ask why I had not heard back from them, told he was working on other projects to and she would check with him, ask to be called for update. 
Feb. 20, 2016 I went back into my email and found an email from Michael dated Jan. 25, saying Anna said I had called, it takes long due to my circumstance but said he would have it by Wed. with would be (1-27-16). Today is February 20, 2016 and I have not heard from or received any word from Horizon.

We came to Horizon with a home that was in poor shape and needed not only remodeling, but also major infrastructure repair and updates, such as piping, wiring, A/C and heating, etc.  Horizon was proactive in advising us on design, selection and quality of materials, forthcoming with responses to our questions and concerns.  I am not what you'd call an "easy" customer, but Horizon was very responsive in resolving the issues that inevitably come up with any project of this scope.  They have also shown that they are willing to follow up on post-project touch-ups, etc; they are determined that we be fully satisfied with the project. 

We are extremely happy in our "new" home (it IS like new to us,) and gladly recommend them.  The project was very expensive, due to the damage and poor maintenance accruing over many years, and Horizon was also helpful in assisting us to find financing when our other sources were VERY slow and unhelpful in responding.

Our kitchen was gross. A DIY job by the previous owner on the cheap. Nasty drawers and cabinets that would shed wood particles all over our plates. A poorly placed dishwasher that couldn't open all the way made it completely useless. It needed to go. 

We researched contractors for over 6 months. Interviewed and got bids from 4. Horizon was the most expensive, which was a concern for us - but their strong reviews, experience and overall professionalism gave us peace of mind that was worth the additional cost. 

They worked with our budget to put together a plan that met our needs. After signing with them there were some unexpected things that came up. A few change orders, and our project manager left the company just as we started demo... But throughout, Mark and Enna were helpful and responsive.  

The foreman Effy and his whole crew were great to work with and they made a point to leave the job site neat and tidy at the end of the day.

This was our first major remodel and we're not the most laid back folks... So it was stressful. Despite all of our little worries along the way, Horizon ultimately came through and gave us the beautiful kitchen that we had been dreaming of.

My kitchen project involved completely demolishing my old kitchen and making a brand new one. This also involved removing a load-bearing post and widening the opening to my living room. When I first spoke with Horizon, I had no idea what I wanted to do with the space, other than removing the load-bearing post and opening the doorway. The first time I met with the Project Manager, he showed me pictures of other kitchens, measured my existing kitchen, and sketched out some ideas of how the space could be redone. I appreciated the time he took to help develop how the new space would look. As with any construction project, there were a couple minor delays, and that’s to be expected. As a result, the project took a bit longer to complete than anticipated. What resulted was a beautiful, functional, new kitchen and I am so happy with the outcome. While the Project Manager that I had initially worked with left the company mid-project, the work continued to be carried out as planned. I only met Mark one time toward the latter part of the project, but was told that he had been at my home regularly throughout the project. Enna was my e-mail angel; always replying in a timely manner to my questions and concerns. The foreman that worked at my house was very helpful and kept in communication with me. I love my new kitchen and look forward to many years of enjoyment with family and friends. I would use Horizon again for future home improvement projects.

Hi Enna!Mark was here this morning to check out our Bathroom and we are sad we missed him!  We wanted to give him a great big thank you and a hug!  Please tell him thanks from us!  Thanks to you too Enna, Caroline, Anna, Sam and your whole crew!  You all have made this experience very pleasant!  All of you have been kind, considerate and made us feel like we mattered!  We appreciate you!We absolutely love our bathroom!  It's beautiful and works so much better for us!  I have been posting pictures and telling friends and family about the whole experience!  I have one lady who may redo her bathrooms and another today that asked for your name to give to her daughter!  We will continue to brag about you and our bathroom!Thank you again!Marlene and Dennis Baker

This was the fourth project that Horizon Construction has done for us. They did a complete remodel of our kitchen, both bathrooms, and removed popcorn ceilings and repainted two family rooms. This project involved removing a chimney that sat perpendicular from the wall in the middle of our family room. They did the complete demo in one day, sealing off the room with plastic to cut down on dust as much as they could. Very impressed! They had to patch the roof, patch the ceiling, and the wall. The very creative part was what to do with the floor area where the chimney base had been. The tile on the floor surrounding the area was discontinued so we were able to find a similar tile that their amazing tile guy laid at a diagonal and it looks fantastic!!! As I have always stated before, Horizon is not perfect (let me know if you do find a contractor who does perfect work the very first time!!). But they will always make sure you are completely satisfied with the work before leaving, no matter what. I respect that and that is why they have come back to do work at our house four times!!!

Master Bath Remodel.  This is the third time we hired Horizon.  We were very happy with their previous work (a kitchen remodel and replacing all the crown molding and baseboards throughout the house) so we had no hesitation in hiring them again.   Mark came over and we talked through our wish list for the bathroom remodel.  He offered useful suggestions and came back to us quickly with a detail plan and a price.  Mark met with us twice at the tile store to help us make our selections.  The whole project then proceeded very smoothly.  Enna was quite helpful along the way in keeping us up to date and on top of all the decisions that had to be made.  Workers were there every day and they were all well-skilled, polite and neat.  There were a few issues that came up, but Mark and Enna and the workers always heard our concerns and made sure that everything was always completed to our complete satisfaction.   The bathroom turned out beautifully with clean lines and gorgeous materials, just like we dreamed of.

Description Of Work: 

Initially called them for some upstairs floor repair, tile and carpet replacement throughout house, including replacement of baseboards. Upon removal of carpet, found some cracks indicative of foundation damage.  City engineer required geologic report which contractor arranged for, and contractor worked with city to settle on required remediation, (significant concrete footing additions and drainage) which was responsible for 2/3 of total cost. Contractor also replaced stair banister and rail and installed new front door.


Member Comments: 


The project timeline was extended significantly by the discovery of the need for foundation work and the involvement of the City in that process.  Otherwise, all the work of the contractor was excellent, timely and efficient.  Every day the worksite was left clean and the house was livable through entire process.  Workers were very skilled and eager to please and did excellent work. We had purchased new lighting for the house and they arranged for an electrician to do the installation for us.

Omri, the project manager, was excellent at keeping us apprised of scheduled work times and visits, and with suggestions or variations of our ideas to enhance the house further. The business owner, Mark, was on site from time to time, including at the foundation specialist's initial visit. Occasionally additional work was recommended, generally for completion of the remodeling, or as recommended for long term benefit.

Horizon's quality of work is excellent, they are honest, and the price of the work is fair. I can not overstate my satisfaction with my relationship with them.

My husband and I started our remodeling journey in February 2015. At first we wanted to just update our kitchen. But after a while we decided to expand the project and remove the walls between the kitchen, dining room and family room and create one big open space. We worked with a construction company for more than 3 months. We met with them many times and finally we decided they were not up to the task. 
My husband found Horizon from the Angie’s list and he setup an appointment.  When Mark came to our house he explained the process to us. They would do the the plans, get them approved  by the city and then we could use him for construction or go with another companies. He gave us a reasonable price for the drawings. He also showed us many pictures from different projects he had worked on. Projects in which he had moved or removed walls. That was important to me. Horizon move very quickly and we had  approved plans in less than 3 weeks. Our project was not just upgrading rooms. There was serious structural change we needed to do. Removing all 3 load bearing walls and adding 2 huge beams across the house. It still scares me when I think about it. 
The construction project was supposed to take 3 months. The crews were in our house almost every day. And they worked really hard. The job site was kept clean and organized. We had a payment chart so we paid each piece after it was done. Demolition, material, footers, etc. I never forget the day we came home after a 3 day trip and saw the walls completely gone, beams up there and for the first time we could see our new space. It was very exciting. There were no big surprises but a few issues did come up but Mark and his team explained them and we work through them easily. Mark responded to all of our concerns and questions and was  always available.
The project finished just under 3 months and we are extremely happy with the result and experience. Mark and his team are true professionals. I also want to add that Enna was very helpful in the entire process keeping us up-to-date. Horizon made this project look easy. But I know it was not. They basically took our 1970 old, outdated and dark house and brought it to year 2015 making it look bright and open. Thank you Horizon Construction

We chose Horizon Construction for  a master bathroom remodel. The company was very professional, the project manager was extremely organized. Workers showed up each day when scheduled and left everything clean at the end of the day. The owner always did a final inspection. The final product was beautiful! We will definitely use them again for the next remodel.

The project went smoothly from beginning to end.  Omri, the project manager, was very helpful and patient in helping choose the tile and fixtures for the bathroom.  Tal and his crew were very good at their jobs, whether it be the demo or the plumbing or tiling. Enna in the office kept us informed of the schedule which was very helpful.  The end result is a beautiful bathroom that we love!  Thank you Horizon!

Not many people would describe a kitchen renovation as a pleasant experience, but my husband and I would. 

Ours is a 50s tract home, and we wanted to update the small kitchen without it looking out of synch with the rest of the house, what we like to call "mid century modest," AND we wanted to incorporate our vintage white Wedgewood range. We're a bit eclectic in our taste and were looking for someone who "got" our vision...kind of mid century without the kitsch or the ultra moderne style, with maybe a little Craftsman thrown in for good measure. It was a challenge to find that someone in our area.

We initially got quotes from two other contractors who were willing to do what we thought we wanted. When we met with our third candidate, Mark Besnos of Horizon Construction & Remodeling, and described our desire to, for instance, relocate the sink, Mark said "You don't want to do that." At first we were taken aback, then saw the wisdom when he explained why moving the sink would be a big mistake. He was absolutely right, and we hired him on the spot.

From Day 1 we were impressed by the steady communication with the office (run by his lovely wife, Enna) letting us know what to expect from day to day and addressing any questions or concerns we might have. We were equally impressed by the attention to detail and overall craftsmanship performed by each member of Mark's crew: every single detail was honed to perfection...cabinetry, floor tile, backsplash, paint, installations, even cleanup. A few changes were accommodated without undue stress or expense. 

We did have one unfortunate surprise when the load-bearing wall with the pass-through between the dining area and kitchen turned out to need reinforcement due to the work of the "handyman" who had owned the house before us. He had actually cut the support beams to create the pass-through, left them dangling, and then just closed up the wall. It's a miracle the house didn't fall down during an earthquake! So even though the fix meant a little more money than we anticipated, it was absolutely necessary and we now have a safer, more stable home. And the pass-through looks stunning! 

I did want to mention that the Caesarstone "Concrete" countertop is NOT suitable for a family with kids as it shows every handprint and drip. I failed to read the caveat on the Caesarstone Care & Maintenance page that clearly states: "Please understand that Honed, Concrete and Motivo™ finishes will require more daily maintenance than our polished finishes. Since there is more exposed surface area with these finishes, metal marks, fingerprints and other signs of daily living will show on these materials." Bottom line: I've become a bit obsessive with a micro fiber towel always at hand.

Horizon is a small, family-owned business run by and staffed by kind, caring, and competent professionals each of whom goes the extra mile to provide complete customer satisfaction. Even though Mark had to leave the country unexpectedly, the job stayed on track during his absence and was finished within the expected timeframe. 

It's no wonder Horizon has so many positive reviews, and we will definitely be using them again when we're ready to tackle our outdated bathrooms.

We had no intention of redoing our 58-year-old kitchen (we had put up with it for so long) until Anna from Horizon called one day.  I never appreciate sales calls, but Anna was so pleasant that I scheduled a consultation with Mark.  He was very thorough and helpful.  Before we knew it, our kitchen was being completely renovated.  Everyone at Horizon was very patient with us as we chose materials and I invariably worried about everything!  Mark and Enna kept reassuring me that it would all be fine, and they would take care of everything.  And they did!  They redid our kitchen and pantry from top to bottom.  They also replaced the floor in the entry and guest bathroom, and replaced all the door and floor moldings.  Their workers were skilled, very polite and respectful, and cleaned up after themselves every afternoon before they left.  The finished kitchen is gorgeous!  Exactly what I wanted.....simple, clean, and warm!  It is a perfect kitchen for this house.  Any issues, large or small, that arose were taken care of to our satisfaction. Mark, Enna and the rest of their office and construction crew were wonderful.  I'm actually going to miss them!  I would not hesitate to recommend them, and I will not hesitate to call them for future projects.

We are very pleased with our new master bathroom! It is gorgeous! The bathroom was gutted and Horizon replaced the tiled walk-in shower and bathroom floor, installed a custom vanity and two huge framed mirrors, and all new plumbing and electrical fixtures. They also scraped, textured and painted our master bedroom ceiling. Mark was creative in helping us with design ideas and made sure all the details that we envisioned were taken care of to our satisfaction. Enna was in the office and guided us through the process, answering any questions or concerns we had along the way. She was knowledgeable herself, or she referred our questions to Mark or Tal, our foreman. Communication was quick and constant...either by email or phone. All the people who worked on our project were courteous, competent, and kept our home as clean as possible, tidying up each day before leaving. Our project started on time and finished on time, with people working every day. We always felt we were in very good hands. With anyone else we might have had a nice bathroom, but with Horizon we have a BEAUTIFUL bathroom!

Services provided: Bathroom remodels, bathroom addition, tongue-in-groove ceiling, built-in cabinetry  around fireplace, pergola, fencing. 
My husband and I are extremely happy with the work performed by Horizon Construction. All the built-ins and cabinetry work are beautiful. The bathrooms are the envy of our friends and neighbors. Every team of construction specialists that came into our house took great pride in their work. And outside, the pergola and new fencing are beautiful as well. Indeed, our house could be featured as a 'before and after' transformation in a designer magazine. With a project of this magnitude, there are bound to be surprises behind the walls. What was so great about Horizon was that they stepped up to the plate and went above and beyond to resolve every issue. Customer service is not just lip service with them, they take it to heart. Their reputation as a premier remodeler is very important to them. Our project manager, Omri Nave, was professional and extremely responsive, as was Enna Eskin in the office. 
As a side note I should add that we were originally going with another contractor recommended by friends, but after many weeks and still no firm bid from that contractor, I searched for a contractor on Angie's List.  Omri from Horizon came out immediately and met with my husband at the house we had just purchased (I was in Arizona at the time). Omri worked until very late that night to prepare the detailed bid, and my husband signed on the dotted line without hesitation.
It is never easy to go through a remodel project of this size, especially while you are living in the house. But we are so grateful to the Horizon team for their professionalism and dedication to customer satisfaction. What few issues came up were resolved quickly and without hassle. We would recommend Horizon Construction and Remodeling without reservation.

I have never written a review about any company before mainly because I have never worked with a company that delivered what it promised.  That ended when we contracted Horizon Construction and Remodeling. Not only was the work done beautifully but was finished within the timeline we set, and they delivered as promised.
I can't say enough about this company.  Mark Besnos and his crew are without a doubt the best contractor and professionals we have ever worked with.  When we first met with Mark we knew he was the right guy.  He works within your budget and has so many great ideas that help with your design decision making.   Also, behind every successful company there is a very professional office staff.  Enna Eskin makes sure that all the paper work is done and expedited on time.  She's great to work with and is there to answer any questions you might have.  You feel like family with this company because they take such good care of you.  
Mark oversees every aspect of the project himself. He arrived everyday before and after his workers finished their work and walked through the project and inspected it.  If something didn't meet his approval he would tag it and have them redo it.  He is a perfectionist and it shows when the project is done.  His crew cleaned up every night after they finished their work and left us with a clean house to live in and that was not an easy task to do.  We remodeled out Master Bath, put new granite and a backsplash in the kitchen, installed wood floors throughout the house, and a beautiful new staircase.
If you are looking for the Rolls Royce of Contractors, don't look any further.  Horizon Construction and Remodeling is the company for you want.  You won't be disappointed.

When we bought our home, we knew we wanted to take on a massive remodel/upgrade. We interviewed and gathered estimates from four Southern California general contractors, all of them coming in with high ratings and reviews from Houzz, Yelp, Angie’s List and BBB. Horizon did not come in the lowest bidder, however, their professionalism, conduct of business, their interaction with their clients and attention to detail was what made them stand out from the others. 

Undergoing a project as big as ours (a complete remodel of master bath, all new windows and doors, new flooring throughout the house, a complete new stair case, opening up a room, blowing out wall, painting the whole interior, changing out hardware, adding a pergola and incorporating a 15' bi-fold door) there are going to be bumps and unforeseen turns in the road. 

From relocating an outlet for daily convenience to installing a new header beam to comply with city permitting, no task was too small for Horizon the scope of our remodeling project. Their team of designers and contractors walked us through picking out our materials, gave us experienced advice and listened to our dream home vision. What we originally though we wanted or thought about forgoing, Horizon helped us plan and design around our budget and keep the big picture in perspective. At the end of the six-month project we were very impressed with how Horizon handed all the different types of issues and challenges that arouse. 

This house is our "20 year home" where will be raising our children, having family gatherings and hosting countless friends. We have now lived the home for three months (construction free) and we are very happy with the quality of service and out come of our remodel done by the team at Horizon Construction and Remodel.

I hired Horizon for an excavation and construction project for a second living unit on my property. They made the whole process so smooth. Omer, the project manager and designer, was extremely helpful. I felt like I was his only priority. He made the hardest stage of my project so easy. I have actually gained a friend from the process that we went through and him making it so enjoyable. There was not a single struggle even in the inevitable unforeseen obstacles. He made them dissolve. In a way, I want to have another project just so I can work with them all over again.

Working with Mark and Enna from Horizon Construction and Remodeling was a great experience.  They were professional, punctual, precise, and communicative.  Each day work was performed, their workers made sure to leave as little impact or disturbance in the area.  The work done is of high quality - they were able to transform our bathroom out of the 1960s into something modern, clean, and functional.  We were in constant communication via text/phone/email.  They were very patient when we were picking out our cabinet colors - leaving us samples to ensure that we got the exact color and style we wanted.  And of the three contractors we bid the job out to, there price was very reasonable.  I appreciated the personal touch they add to their service - always making sure that we were satisfied with each step of the process.  We will definitely be calling Mark and Enna again when it comes time to get our kitchen out of the 60s.

The project included ceiling repair and remodeling in entry hall, dining room and living room.  The process was easy, efficient, and included myself throughout the steps.  Pricing was fair, timing was accommodating, and I am most pleased with the results.  Omer Barel was terrific and made me feel that I was in most capable, confident hands.  Overall, a good experience, and I would recommend them to anyone.

This is the kitchen my wife has been waiting for since we bought our house 16 years ago.  She loves the final product!  To be honest, we were not planning on spending this much on our kitchen remodel; however, we chose Horizon based on over 100 reviews and our experiences with other contractors in the past.  So, based on the reviews, we knew we were going to spend more money than the average kitchen remodel.  Having dealt with several projects over the years, I also was aware we were going to go over budget along with having some challenges along the way.  We did have a couple of issues that looked like they were going to go sideways, but Horizon listened to and took care of those issues to the best of their ability each time--and, to good effect.  I spent the most time communicating with Enna--almost always over the phone or by E-mail--and found her easy to work with.  I had read reviews that said some things about Enna being difficult to get along with, but I did not find that to be the case.  Keep in mind, all of the reviews that had those comments in them did not actually have work done by Horizon.  Enna was there to help solve a couple of problems by making certain one of her crew got to our house, by coming to our house herself, or by, for example, crediting us $741 for the ceiling drywall replacement [because I thought we did not need to replace it].  There were several Horizon employees that helped the remodeling experience [often stressful] more tolerable.  Horizon arranged to have a Porta-Potty outside our house so the workers would not have to use our bathrooms.  They also arranged the appointments with the city for the permit inspections.  There were some communication problems at times; however, I soon learned that going straight to Enna was the best way to solve any problems that cropped up.  If anyone wonders why I rated Horizon a "B" for price I have a simple answer:  their are not the low-end bid--they are likely closer to the higher-end bid.  But, you get what you pay for.  So, the "B" is to give prospective customers a heads-up that you ought to plan accordingly.  That said, we chose an expensive (beautiful) piece of granite, had special space-saving aspects added to our cabinets, glass-tile backsplash, under-counter lighting, travertine tile floor, and more.  There were no significant surprises except . . . WE REALLY LOVE OUR NEW KITCHEN!  However, I would say that was more of an expectation than a surprise.

Due to a water leak issue, I had to remodel my kitchen and part of the family room.  After many interviews and careful consideration I selected Horizon Construction and Remodeling who, in addition, was highly rated by customers on Angie’s list.  It proved to be a very good decision!  Mr. Ormi Nave was my Project Manager whose expertise guided me through design, style and material selections.  The cabinet maker, electrician, plumber, painter/drywall, tile installer were all excellent at their craft!  Upper management also reviewed on-site work excellence and progression.  The Horizon team maintained a high level of professionalism and integrity throughout the entire project.   I highly recommend Horizon for your next project!

Our project consisted of a complete kitchen remodel (including soffit removal and fireplace facelift) along with new flooring and cabinets in the bathroom and laundry room.  We also replaced the flooring in the entry way as well as the coat closet and linen cabinet.    Horizon Construction was not the least or most expensive quote we gathered.  One deciding factor for us was that Mark offered ideas and suggestions during the quoting process.  We had a general concept that we were shooting for but this was our first kitchen remodel so we were also looking for expert advice on layout, materials and design.  Response time to questions and change orders was quick.  As with any work in an older home, surprises occurred and adjustments were made throughout the project which affected the timeline and cost.  Mark walked us through these obstacles as he knew we were detail oriented.  We did experience some discrepancies in what was agreed upon with Mark and what was executed by the crew.  These mistakes were all quickly fixed at no additional cost to us (other than time lost).  We had an assigned foreman for some of the trades but ultimately Mark acted as our main point of contact for everything.  The crew was professional, hard-working and respectful.  We were not pleased with the semi-custom cabinet installers.  Horizon’s custom cabinet maker who worked on some of our other pieces was much better with a higher quality product.   Final cabinet details were fixed and completed in a timely manner by him.  Overall, we were very pleased with the final results!

Kitchen Remodel.
Horizon just completed a gut rehab remodel of our kitchen (which included removing a wall) and we were very pleased with the whole process. This was our first remodeling project and we didn't quite know what to expect going into it. We worked primarily with Omri who did an absolutely wonderful job keeping everything on track and helping us each step of the way. He truly went above and beyond to ensure that our needs were met and that we were happy with the end result. The remodel was completed in a timely manner and each of the work crews that came in were courteous, professional and cleaned everything up at the end of each day. Another plus for us was that Horizon was all inclusive. We didn't have to choose a separate place to buy/install the cabinets from and another for the counters, etc. They handle everything which makes it so much easier!

Horizon Construction did an incredible job on our kitchen from day one!  Omri and Mark have been there each step of the way with great ideas and suggestions and then they bring fantastic workers in to make them a reality.  From countertops to cabinets to floors and plumbing they have the best of the best working for them.  We had a kitchen wall that needed to be removed and needless to say my wife and I were worried about tearing our house apart!  Horizon managed the process with precision and now the house looks like it was originally built without that wall. I can't say enough good things about this team - they are professional, diligent, responsible, fairly priced and they always do what they say they are going to do.  We have had a couple of issues along the way but Horizon demonstrated their commitment to customer service each time something came up.  They take responsibility and fix issues as they arise without any questions.  I would highly recommend Horizon to friends and family and encourage anyone considering a remodel to use them.

Removed bathtub in master suite and constructed a walk-in shower, added a second water line to accommodate the shower heads, constructed a pocket door to separate the bedroom from the dressing room.  Electrical included led lights in my home office and other electrical work,  installed new faucets in the kitchen and 3 bathrooms and painted...

I chose Horizon Construction and Remodeling (HCR) because of their excellent presentation and fabulous reputation on Angie’s List. This was a wise decision because HCR proved to be an ethical, caring and efficient company. My original remodeling job was to remove the bathtub in the master suite and install a walk-in shower. During the remodeling, I added additional electrical, plumbing changes and repairs to my home. The HCR crew held my hands throughout the whole process. The office staff called me frequently to check how I was doing and to make sure everything was going okay.  The workers, in my home, were hardworking, fast and clean. There were a couple of hiccups with the job but I was very impressed with the prompt, same day, actions taken to correct any problems. In addition, all inspections were passed on first try. The price was reasonable for all of the work done and some things were not even charged. I whole heartedly recommend Horizon Construction and Remodeling and I will call them again for my next remodeling project. 
Ella C.

Our contractor was Mark Besnos.  Mark is definitely who you want doing your remodeling.  Mark is fastidious.  His attention to detail was unbelievable.  As picky as he is, I wouldn't want to be his wife.  As with any job, there were things that needed tweaking.  Mark made sure everything was absolutely perfect.  We had an issue with the stainless steel tiles for the backsplash.  After installing it was obvious that some of the tiles had a different finish (brushed finish instead of shiny finish).  Mark had the tile company come to the house.  He made sure the issue was fixed.  His office staff, Enna, and Anna, were terrific.  There was never a time when I called that I didn't get a hold of Mark, Enna, or Anna.  The best part, everyone who has come to see the kitchen, even all the subcontractors, complimented us on the kitchen.  It should be on the cover of Better Homes & Gardens.  Sherry.

There are already the well-acknowledged passages associated with life; birth, marriage, divorce, graduation, the new job. I’d like to add one more—remodeling.

The decision to embark upon the renovation path, in most cases, involves entering into a relationship with a contractor. Selecting one, in many respects, is only slightly less important than say choosing a spouse or deciding to have children. Remodeling your home can be a journey filled with uncertainty, havoc and frustration as you work toward the beautiful surroundings you envisioned those many months earlier. As the old knight who guarded the room of chalices in a scene from the movie, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade, mused, “Choose wisely.” 

Fortunately, we did when we contracted with Mark of Horizon Construction. You want your contractor to be competent, trustworthy, and reliable. Mark was all of these and more. 

Mark takes a personal interest in his work. He is on the site much of the time ensuring that his workers are doing their best. When things go wrong, he makes sure they get fixed. Like any relationship, there will be disagreements or misunderstandings, but Mark handled them in a professional and sincere manner. The bottom line here is that Mark wants his customers to be happy.

I could relate several episodes of Mark’s commitment to customer satisfaction, but the one that meant the most to us was when we had a sewer line back up into the house (no fault of Mark’s). Out of panic, I called Mark and he came out immediately and with his foreman worked on clearing the line. He didn’t have to do that. He could have told us to call a plumber and gone back to what he was doing.

I highly recommend Horizon Construction and Mark as your choice for your remodel project. You will have chosen wisely.

My initial experience with Enna when I first called to set up an appointment was very professional and pleasant. We set up an appointment to meet with Mark, the GC, within 2 weeks of the call. Mark was professional, listened well to what we had in mind, augmented these visions with his own excellent design ideas, and made us feel very confident at the first meeting that Horizon was likely the best choice for us. After meeting with several other GCs over the next few weeks, Horizon was in our top 3 finalists, and we made the choice to move forward with them based on our feelings of confidence that they really understood what we wanted to do. Horizon was not the lowest bidder, nor were they the highest.
 After confirming with Mark our choice to move forward with Horizon, we met with him again to go over in more detail the project scope and timeline and to sign paperwork for the plan development. The initial project timeline was identified as 10-12 weeks. Soon after this meeting, he swiftly had plans drawn up for the architectural changes to our kitchen and living room and submitted them for approval. Expecting approval to take several weeks, Mark suggested we start working on the master bathroom remodel so as not to lose momentum. During Master Bath demolition, Mark identified some unanticipated framing work after the walls were stripped. Although I was not expecting this, we compromised on the cost of addressing this work, which set the tone for addressing unexpected work going forward. Work on the Master Bath went longer than expected based on some changes to scope as well as some permit hang-ups, but the finished product was exactly what we wanted.
 Approval of the Kitchen\Living Room plans came back quicker than expected (in a few days as opposed to weeks), and work on the kitchen and living room commenced and ran concurrent with the work on the master bathroom. This work involved removing walls between the galley kitchen, the den/4th bedroom, the living room and the dining area with the ultimate design goal being a great room spanning all of these areas. Due to removing load-bearing walls, support beams had to be installed in the attic and 6 foot deep underpinnings had to be dug and placed in a several areas. Although the inside of our house was unrecognizable, the work proceeded on schedule for the most part. During the project, we did make some adjustments to overall scope (not changing planned work, just adding new work to overall scope, e.g., originally we had no intention of touching the fireplace, or any of the bedrooms; we made some decisions midstream to have Horizon redo the fireplace
 and floor and paint all of the bedrooms based upon design ideas from Mark). Change management on these items (and other items) was handled well by Enna. After the Master Bathroom completed, Horizon started on the guest bathroom remodel, which involved the following:

 > Removal of HVAC unit from closet adjacent to the bathroom.
 > Demolition of walls between HVAC closet, bathroom, and adjacent coat closet.
 > Installation of new HVAC unit in the attic.

 Utilizing the square footage from the HVAC closet and the coat closet effectively doubled the square footage of the guest bathroom allowing us to convert it into a full bath with double vanity (from a ¾ bath). This was the last aspect of the project to complete.Considering that we lived in the house through the project (with the exception of 3 non-continuous weeks for vacation), we were eager to see the project complete, and we are extremely happy with the results. Horizon saw the vision we had for transforming the interior of our 55 year old ranch style house into something more modern and beautiful, and they executed on it.
 The only negative thing I feel compelled to note is that the crew was not considerate about keeping the work site clean: Paint brushes were rinsed out in the plants in the front yard; razors, cuttings from wood, discarded pieces of wire, food wrappings, etc continually littered my front yard and driveway. I asked Mark and Enna to address with their crew at least two times, however it didn't fix the situation and I ultimately ended up cleaning up after the crew. This may seem petty or perhaps I am naïve about a project of this magnitude, but it made me feel disrespected as a customer for my concerns about this to go effectively ignored.
 Lastly I have to say that, Horizon Construction (Mark, Enna and their whole crew) we're extremely friendly and nice throughout the entirety of the project. Never once did I second guess my choice. By the end of the project, I still felt comfortable that we had made the best choice. Since the completion of the project, Horizon has cheerfully addressed any issues that have come up.

We hired Mark and his team to come and install Marble flooring in our formal dining/living room. They were quick, efficient and very clean. He was very thorough about what the layout was going to look like, making sure to ask if I had any changes to the design. It came out looking gorgeous. Enna was also very personable and thorough. Confirmations for everything was emailed and discussed so there were no "surprises" or hiccups and misunderstandings. Overall they did a great job.

We have been working with Horizon Construction for many years now. Their projects are beautiful and we are proud to be a part of it. They are detail oriented and give close attention to every aspect of their work. Enna & Mark have been a pleasure to work with, easy going and pleasant .

Roy
Owner - Lion Windows and Doors

When we first met Mark Besnos (owner) at our house, he asked a lot of questions, offered suggestions, and was not at all afraid to offer his opinion when he thought we were wrong (this can be off-putting I suppose, except after you work with Mark for a while you will come to appreciate that he really knows what he is doing and you should listen to him!).  Of the five bids we received for this work, Mark's was by far the most detailed and the only one that covered all of the details we discussed.  Not the cheapest bid by far, but when I went back and looked at the holes in the other bids I had no doubt they would have change ordered us to death and I would have ended up spending the same or more likely more.

The work started promptly and once started stayed pretty much on schedule throughout.  Enna always kept us informed when things were going to be done, so there were never any major surprises.  There were problems along the way as there always are in remodeling, and this is where Horizon really shines in my opinion - Mark always said "Don't worry, we will take care of it", and they always did.  Every time.  If you have had remodel work done before you know how rare this is.  It's the way a business should be run, unfortunately many contractors don't seem to get it.

We are extremely pleased with the work they did.  In particular, our master bath which has all new cabinetry, onyx counter, travertine floors and shower walls, frameless glass shower and rainfall shower are spectacular.  I remark to my wife when I get out of the shower in the morning that I feel like I'm staying at the Ritz Carlton! 

Thanks Mark and Enna.  You guys are great!

We have working with Horizon for many years, they give every customer personalized attention and they have an eye for detail work. They are experts in the area of remodeling with an eye for fresh ideas in the design field. Trusted reliable service, It doesn't get any better in customer service!

The remodeling included the demolition and reconstruction of 2 bathrooms. It included converting the guest bath to a walk-in shower with tile and a frameless glass enclosure. The job included replacing the vanities, countertops, installing porcelain tile throughout, new bathtub installed in the master bath, changes to the plumbing and all new fixtures including sinks, exhaust fans, and lighting. 
We selected Horizon Construction & Remodeling because of the good ratings they received from customers who had work done by them. The cost was higher than some other quotes I received but I was concerned about the quality of the workmanship and considered the customer satisfaction ratings Horizon received from their customers. As it turned out, the work was completed on time, within budget and the quality of the work was excellent. We are very satisfied with how everything turned out. As in any project, issues arise but they were quickly resolved with no excuses. Mark inspected the work as it progressed and Enna communicated with us every step of the way so there were no surprises. They got a building permit from the City of Huntington Beach for the remodeling as we requested and we had no problems passing any phase of the inspection process. We would recommend them to our friends.

Added 215 sq.ft. to Master Bedroom including enlarged and remodeled Master Bathroom, siting area, and walk-in closet.
Member Comments: 
This was the second project we've contracted with Horizon (first was a kitchen remodel in 2009). Work was completed on schedule, within budget, and met all our expectations. Horizon kept us apprised of the progress by email (e.g. "Tomorrow they will install the counter top"). They stayed on the job until every item on our "Punch List" had been addressed to our satisfaction. Mark and Enna are a very nice couple and are a joy to work with. When unforeseen problems arise (and they always do), Enna's voice over the phone is very calming and reassuring and indeed all problems were resolved. Mark walks through the project frequently and will spot items that don't meet his expectations and see that they are corrected without us having to say a word.
We will definitely use them again for our next project.

Horizon had to take down two walls and put In a beam to create our open layout kitchen. It was a huge job and we took three bids. But the other two bids wouldn't take out the walls, and we didn't want to settle. Mark said yes right away and brought an engineer who gave the okay. Every change easy passed by us for approval and the work was done very well. Issues we had after the remodel were handled. Someone visiting said it looked like it was always there, but my husband and I know what a huge transformation this kitchen was to our house and our lives. Enna was a great lifeline through the whole project which was completed before the estimated time.

Complete remodel of kitchen, demo of old exterior concrete stone and fireplace. Replaced with stack stone. Installation of wood flooring. 


We went through several contractors (6 to be exact) before we found the right one. From the moment we called Horizon Construction, Enna made use feel very comfortable. We explained to Enna what we wanted and what we were looking for. She stated that Mark Besnos would be out to see us and see what he can do. Mark who is the owner and designer gave us a very beautiful vision of what our kitchen would look like. We felt at ease with Mark and fell in love with his ideas. We have finally found our contractor. We only had signed a contract with Horizon to remodel our kitchen but asked mark what he could also do with the exterior of the house and gave us another beautiful vision. He recommended to remove the old concrete stone around the house and by the fireplace and replace it with stack stone. The final out come is amazing. We also wanted to remove the old carpet and install wood flooring and gave him the job as well and they did an excellent job of installing our wood flooring. Our overall experience with the Horizon Construction crew was very good. The crew was very polite, on time, and cleaned up after them selves at the end of the work day. Mark and his foreman Elly were there almost everyday to ensure that the projects were getting done as we have specified and would correct any issues we had with some of the installations. Given the amount of time we gave Horizon Construction they finished the job as specified and did a beautiful job. We have gotten many, many compliments on our house and can only thank Mark, Enna, Elly and the Horizon Construction crew for all there hard work and for making our experience and great one.

Just want to say that we are extremely happy with the kitchen remodel that Horizon Construction completed for us. Our home was built in the late 1940s and was really showing its age. We wanted to have an open floor plan that incorporated the kitchen, dining room and living room. We had some ideas and a budget for what we were willing to spend. Mark took our ideas and make them come to life! He has an eye for design and style and a commitment to quality and detail. He and Enna are both committed to making sure their clients are satisfied and happy.
We took out a load bearing wall between the old kitchen and living room and now have a wonderful large room. This was the second kitchen remodel I have lived through and this one was definitely the best. Mark said he would be finished in 9 weeks and he was! Their crew worked Monday through Friday and showed up every day.  Enna called daily to keep us up to date, making sure we had appliances and spec sheets ready for the crew and making sure all our questions were answered. 
Mark was at the house every morning to direct the crew and attend to any details. He made sure that everything that we couldn’t see was done correctly as well as attending to details like overhead lamp and outlet placement and overall design functionality and appearance. Mark had the placement of the lamp over our dining table changed several times (without our knowing) until he was satisfied that it would be in the right place – and it was!
The crew was absolutely great. They arrived at about the same time every morning, went right to work but were always patient and answered any questions we may have had. The absolute best thing is that they cleaned up their work area every day without fail. They put up plastic so construction dust in the rest of the house was kept to a minimum which I really appreciated.
If you are wondering if Horizon is the company for you – our answer is YES! Do it, you will be very happy with the result. We sure are!

We chose Horizon Construction because of Mark's vision for our bathrooms in our initial consultation. Our bathrooms are rather small, and we had a few ideas of what we wanted before Mark came over, but he quickly suggested what would and wouldn't work based on his extensive experience and design knowledge. Mark is very good at being straightforward with you on what needs to be done for the space you have to renovate. Some might consider his straightforwardness slightly abrupt, but don't let that put you off - he's very good at what he does and has a passion for his work and the details, and he knows the work his crew does is a reflection of himself and his company (as he should).

We mainly interacted with Enna, Horizon's business manager and design consultant, from that point forward, though Mark did visit the project regularly. He also made himself available at any time should you want to go over any details with him. Enna's responsiveness and regular communication is a big reason we are as happy as we are with how the project turned out. Not many contracting companies have someone like Enna to be your customer service rep., design consultant, project coordinator, complaint department, etc. Enna is very responsive, competent, nice, and professional, and made the 2+ months of having workers in our home a tolerable (and almost pleasant :-) ) experience. 

Day one, Enna and Mark met us at the tile store to sign the contracts and help us pick out flooring, countertops, and glass borders, which was incredibly helpful. Work began quickly afterwards, and the crew was at our house just about every week day for around 2 months. Each crew member was very nice, respectful, hard working, and we trusted them implicitly to work and lock up after themselves while we were at work. Coming home from work each day was an exciting event; seeing progress was a treat and they always cleaned up after themselves each day. 

Mark visited the site regularly and corrected any issues and small details he found, and listened to any concerns we had. We never felt we were being given the runaround or that our ideas and concerns were insignificant. For example they installed a 4" vanity backsplash which didn't connect well to a 6" wood trim piece. We pointed it out and they tore out the marble backsplash and redid it to 6". 

Now, I'm not saying there weren't frustrations. Some language barriers and miscommunication between ourselves, management, and the crew reared its head from time to time, but whenever issues arose they were always fixed to our satisfaction and never impacted the end product. I don't believe you can have a multi-month long project without these issues arising, and I chalk them up as normal, and don't mark them down for this. 

One miscommunication example was that we asked them to put insulation in the shower plumbing wall which bordered the bedroom for noise reduction. They forgot to do this during the rough plumbing and said if we still wanted it done, they would open up the drywall in the bedroom side, then patch and paint the bedroom wall, which they did end up doing. This was a minor issue, and we would have been fine if they didn't want to do the work, but they went out of their way to make us happy.

Other minor issues stemmed from the crew not looking at the fixtures we purchased before finishing the rough plumbing in the first bathroom. Their expectation was that we would point out anything other than standard fixtures (we had a bar with handheld shower head; they assumed fixed shower head). Our expectation was that they would check with us before commencing rough plumbing (or at least take a look at the fixtures). The result ended up not being a big issue - a slightly less than ideal placement for the water outlet valve. However, we learned a valuable lesson and made sure to go over rough plumbing for the master bath with them beforehand.

In the end, both baths turned out beautiful, more so than I imagined. Overall, we had a very positive experience and highly recommend Horizon. 

A few tips: 
Get your fixtures early; unless you're ordering from a big box store, some items take a few weeks to get in. 

Make sure your expectations and visions are communicated. Enna writes up a detailed scope of work, make sure this is correct, though some items are difficult to envision when you initially go over the contract. 

Make sure to meet with Mark and show him your fixtures and expected placements before the crew starts rough plumbing. It will be much more difficult to change things once this has started.

We had recently purchased a home and wanted to do some extensive remodeling before we moved in. That job included:
- Installing a new loft in a room that had a vaulted ceiling, and tying that new 2nd floor room into the existing stairs and hallway. This included new recessed lighting for both the new loft, and the now-shorter bottom floor room.
- Remodel the kitchen, including removal of an old fireplace to open up the kitchen and living room, new tile floors, reface and refinish all cabinets, replace all appliances, new backsplash
- Create a new bedroom from an existing open space, and re-frame the closet walls in the new room and in the adjoining master closet
- New wood floors in the 1st floor of the house, and new carpeting in the 2nd floor
- New interior paint throughout
- Refinish the front door
- Miscellaneous (installing new lights/fans/etc)

This project required securing a few city permits, which Horizon did without problem.

All in, I think this was about a 3.5mo project. We did not move in until it was completed.

We now love Angie's List because that's how we found Horizon, Mark, Enna, and Eli !

We've had both good contractor experiences, and otherwise. We had never used Horizon prior to this job. Our experience with Horizon has gone very well over these months. We wished we had a bigger budget to have them do more work for us, because they do great work at good value, but eventually we simply had to stop so we could move in.

Horizon is geared for client satisfaction on reasonably sized general contractor jobs. Here's a few excerpts of our experience:
- As we were settling on early design decisions, Mark was really helpful. Mark has a unique set of skills in design, engineering, contracting, etc. He brought great ideas forward that were good value decisions. For example, we were creating a new bedroom for our son which was on the small side. He recognized that, and came up with the idea to reconfigure the closet and master bdrm closet that was reasonable, got us a bigger room for our son, and made use of wasted space so that the master closet is still the same size or slightly larger.
- We had many conversations, as normal for such a project, about materials, finishes, and etc. Mark was really helpful at guiding those discussions to make good value decisions, based on what he heard from us. We've had contractors in the past who really know only one style or price-point and try to push it constantly, but we felt that Mark did a great job of listening to what we wanted and coming up with good creative ideas and compromises based on our objectives.
- Mark, Enna, and Eli were all consistent and reliable. If they said they would meet us at the house at a certain time, they were there on time and ready. We'd be lying if we said they were perfect, but they really made every effort to do their best.
- Our area has a substantial list of HOA requirements. We never once had a single complaint from a neighbor or HOA the entire time, despite a lot of work being done. They hauled off their own trash so our little trash bin wasn't overwhelmed, and generally kept the place picked up. Thanks, Eli !
- Shortly after we started w/Horizon, my husband noticed that somebody had backed into the mailbox and asked Mark if he thought one of his guys had done it. Mark just looked at it, and said "Don't worry, I'll fix it." A couple days later, a new mailbox is there that matched the old one, all fixed up. No debates, just happened.
- Near the end of the project, my husband made a comment about how the drain plumbing was routed. A couple days later, it was fixed. Again, no big debate or issue, just happened.
- After our front door was refinished, the exterior had a green tint to it that we had not expected. It wasn't terrible, and perhaps we were the only ones who would notice. Mark asked how we liked it, and could tell from our first reaction we didn't really like how it looked. But, it was not a terrible issue and we formally told Mark and Enna, in writing, that we'd accept it as-is and not to worry resanding/finishing it only for a modest cosmetic issue. It looked fine, and quality was good, but we just had an expectation of a more brownish deep wood finish. A week or so later, they refinished the door anyway, and now looks perfect.

There are more little stories like that, but you get the point. We thought that Horizon was highly focused on Customer Satisfaction in the way they ran the project from beginning to end. They took care to do good quality work, sought client feedback in a constructive way, and addressed issues quickly and practically. They had to get some city permits in this project which they got without a big problem, and they passed all the city inspections without issue.

One of the things which makes Horizon unique from others we considered was that there was no middle-man handoff from the Sales rep to the person who actually manages the job. We worked with Mark, Enna, and later Eli throughout the entire project. We really enjoyed getting to know them, and we thought the continuity of the relationship definitely contributed to the efficient outcome.

In our experience with Horizon, we found them to be professional, ethical, skilled, and hard-working throughout the process. We would recommend Horizon to our own family members.

Thank You, Horizon. You are a great team !

Horizon Construction immediately responded to our request for a quote. Mark came out to the house, listened to our ideas, and helped us to plan a remodel that exactly fit what we wanted. He also helped with picking out materials that fit our budget.
Work started on time (once all permits were approved), and moved quickly, without any work breaks.
There were no issues in contacting Horizon, and any issues that came up during the project were quickly addressed. 
We would highly recommend the Horizon team (Mark, Enna, and Sam) to any of our friends.
Looking forward to doing business with them again.

Rescued from a nightmare!!!

We had a horrific experience with another contractor which left us with a bathroom that we couldn't use. The contractor lost their license and we were left with realizing we were going to have to start all over again.

Horizon came in a rescued us from our misery and delivered a beautiful new master bathroom! We were able to even get our guest bathroom a partial facelift too and we paid about the same for all of it! The work was done on time and their experts workers were very courteous and always left our house in great shape after a hard day's work.

We will recommend Horizon to all of our friends and family.

Greg and Joanna Busch

Complete remodel of all the entire downstairs and common area of upstairs of 3,100 square foot home. Work included 1) kitchen (design, demolition of old kitchen, new cabinets, granite countertops, plumbing, electrical, relocation of gas cook top and vents, stone flooring, baseboards, and painting 2) family room (design, removal of wet bar, new cabinets, granite countertops, new fireplace, wood flooring, baseboards, and painting), 3) living room (wood flooring, electrical, baseboards, and painting), 4) powder room (design, new cabinets, granite countertops, plumbing, electrical, baseboards, and stone flooring), 5) laundry room (stone flooring, baseboards, and painting), 6) refinishing of wood staircase and upstairs cabinets, and 7) carpet upstairs.

As you can see, this was a major remodel project. I wanted a contractor to oversee all aspects, work with me on the design, stay on top of the job, do professional grade work, and show up every day, all at a fair price. I got that with Horizon. You can go with a cheaper contractor but I doubt you will get all of these qualities. Mark spent a lot of time with my wife and I selecting cabinets, granite countertops, and flooring making design suggestions. He also made recommendations as the job progressed. Enna was in contact with me daily and was a pleasure to deal with. The job started the day they said it would and ended on time. I checked the work done daily. If there was every an issue or I was not happy for some reason it was corrected without discussion. Horizon even did some upgrades to improve the look of the job and did not charge for it. They did not charge any large up front fees instead I paid as each aspect of the job was started and completed. Mark did a final inspection at the end sending some workers back to do minor touch ups. I would highly recommend Horizon.

We recently had new wood floors installed in the entire downstairs of our house.  The job included demolition of existing tile and carpet.  They hauled away the old tile and carpet and did a wonderful job installing my new floors.  Horizon also converted my old patio into a new patio/sunroof.  They added walls around the existing patio and installed windows and a sliding  glass door and doggy door.  I had a wonderful experience working with Horizon Construction and Remodeling.  Mark Besnos and Enna Eskin were very pleasant to talk to and they responded to every call I made to them.  Mark was on the job frequently to be sure things were being done to my satisfaction.  His crew was very hard working and did an excellent job - they were on the job daily and always cleaned up prior to leaving.  I was amazed at the progress that was made each day.  The entire job took approximately 4 weeks and stayed within my budget.  I am very pleased with the final product.  My floors are beautiful and I love my new patio/sunroom.  I would very highly recommend them to anyone that had a  job to be done.  I definitely plan to use them again in the future.

Mark provided the second estimate on my kitchen remodel.  After making some recommendations and suggestions, we settled on a design, and Mark and Enna did their best to work within my budget while still providing quality materials and equipment.  

Enna held my hand through picking out my countertops and cabinets, and even guided me through the purchase of my appliances.   Mark came up with a great design based on my needs and what I had to work with.   Along the way there was some stress and misunderstandings, but both Mark and Enna worked tirelessly to make me happy and come up with great resolutions.    We were in contact every day either by phone or email, and Mark even rushed over on a Saturday when I needed my gas turned back on. 

I can't say enough about the finished product.  It is one of the most beautiful kitchens I've ever seen and it's mine.   Thanks Mark and Enna

Horizon Construction and Remodeling performed a complete remodel of two bathrooms, including expansion of exterior walls to increase size of bathrooms.
The completed work went beyond expectations. Top quality results. The workers were punctual, courteous and cleaned up after themselves. We enthusiastically recommend Horizon Construction and Remodeling for anyone seeking to remodel.
   We also recently added another job for this company, new railing and stairs. An awesome job again .

Horizon Constructions remodeled our guest bathroom, turning a tub into a walk-in frameless glass door shower, replacing the floor, the vanity and the toilet.  

Having had my kitchen remodeled with a different contractor, I was very impressed by the punctuality of Horizon Construction, Enna always kept me updated and in the loop of what to expect and when!  Also updated us promptly on any issues or problems.

Mark had a very keen eye for design and gave us suggestions on the materials for both the floors and the shower and also few other design elements.

Also, they replaced the glass door when Mark noticed a crack that both me and my husband missed!  We really liked the professionalism and the meticulousness that Mark and Enna showed.

It has been two months since the job was completed, but I encountered a recent problem with the shower door and contacted Enna about it.  She assured us when the job was finished that the bathroom was under warranty as well.  She is working on getting the issue addressed.  I love the follow up and the fact that they stand behind their work.

I would definitely recommend this company.

We had a bathroom from 1964 completly remodeled. The original bathroom was about 10 ft. by 4-1/2 ft. with a tub/ shower and dividing wall. We had the tub removed and one wall torn out and rebuilt to expand the room by 2-1/2 ft. We had the original window removed and replaced it with a custom size window which was built into the shower walll. This required structural wall modifications and outside stucco work. We moved all of the plumbing to allow for a large tile shower to be built. This required cutting the slab foundation and installing new drain plumbing for the shower, toilet and sink. New vent pipes were required and had to be installed in the new wall and thru the roof. The shower required extensive plumbing to allow for a cieling rain can, body sprays and a hand held head. We added a fan/ light which required venting thru the roof. The shower was tiled from floor to cieling and the remainder of the room was also tiled about 40" up from the floor. A frameless 3/8" glass door was also installed. Two recessed lights were installed in the shower cieling along with vanity lighting.

Horizon remodeled 3 average-sized bathrooms, and re-tiled a fireplace. The job included: Hot-mopping and floating cement on showers, installing tile on floors, shower, bath surround, and fireplace, installing bathtub, custom shower door and vanities, quartz countertops, sinks, toilets, faucets, fans and lighting, painting, installing baseboards, and bath accessories. 

When I first met with Mark Besnos, it was clear that he had an eye for detail. Mark had some great design ideas, and helped me pick out tile, cabinets. Everything was done very professionally; Mark drew up a detailed contract, and all changes were made with addendums. Mark also provided all of the relevant licenses and insurance documents without having to ask. In the end Mark made sure every last detail was perfect. 

Enna Eskin did an amazing job managing the project. She was always super friendly, knowledgeable, and professional, and was great about using email and text to keep in touch while I was at work. Enna kept me informed of what was happening throughout, and also let me know ahead of time when there were things that I needed to do. 

The work crews were friendly, and considerate. They worked very hard, and performed high-quality work. They did a good job of protecting my floors and furniture, and keeping the mess to a minimum. 

I love my new bathrooms and fireplace. Everything turned out beautifully, and was done on time and within budget.

Early in 2012 we took three contractors' bids for a master bath remodel for our home. In addition to a price we could afford, Horizon Construction gave us some good design ideas and a feeling that they would take good care of us. They weren't the cheapest bid, but we wanted to work with someone who got all the costs out there up front, without adding on later. We felt that's how they made their bid, so we selected them for our job. 

The project would remove the small glass shower enclosure and basically unused bathtub that were there from the original home construction, and also upgrade the vanity with a nicer piece and put a granite top on it. The old toilet would be replaced. The linoleum floor would be replaced with tile which would match nicely the tile of the new shower enclosure.
